course_title: Special Topics MESAS-200 Level: Viewing Iran through its Cinema
class_notes: This course will provide an overview of the modern Iranian society through its cinema, especially in the last 40 years of post-revolutionary Iran.  Its objective is to acquire a body of knowledge about the major social issues of today Iran, including 13 topics: Iranian Society and Cinema; Diversity; Rural Life; Nomads; Revolution; War; Women and Gender Issues; Family and Relationships; Class Conflict; Morality; Education; Immigration; Forbidden Life. In addition to reading articles and book excerpts on these issues, we will watch as many films as possible to see how they are reflected in the cinema as one of the major media of depicting and analyzing social, political and intellectual life in the modern world.
course_description: Special topics in Middle Eastern and South Asian Studies, at the 200 level; may be repeated when content varies.
